document_data.name: Mule
document_data.mainbody: '''Mules''' were pack animals, a cross between [[horse]]s and [[donkey]]s, specifically bred for the purposes of labor.
document_data.Abilities: Mules were bred with the intention of sharing the best traits of its two parent species. They were more sure-footed, hardy, and longer-lived than horses. Compared to donkeys, they were faster and more intelligent.{{Cite web/Forging the Realms/Horl, Breeder of Mules}}
document_data.History:
In the late-15{{th}} century [[DR]], mules were one of many beasts of burden that could be found in the [[Baldur's Gate/Outer City|Outer City]] district of [[Baldur's Gate]], as such animals were outlawed from entering the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower]] and [[Baldur's Gate/Upper City|Upper City]] districts.<ref> 

At that time in the history of Baldur's Gate, the [[Flaming Fist]] mercenary company paid some stables in the Outer City to maintain a reserve group of them.<ref> And whenever merchants traveling the [[Coast Way]] or [[Trade Way]] came to the city, they would leave their mules in either the Outer City or [[Baldur's Gate/Blackgate|Blackgate]].<ref>

Ecology.Diet: Mules were well accustomed to eating [[grass]], requiring no separate fodder.<ref>
Ecology.Relationships:
Mules were a common beast of burden among both [[gold dwarves]] and [[shield dwarves]].<ref> The former typically bred their mules from [[Lhesperan]] or [[Meth]] horses.<ref>

In [[Khôltar]], mules were used to drive pumps that carried water from the small city's reservoir and into the cisterns of buildings.{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks archive|62-63}} Other places in Faerûn were mules were common beasts of burden included [[Turmish]]<ref>{{Cite polyhedron/101/Elminster's Everwinking Eye: Turmish Customers and Festivals|22}} and [[Waterdeep]].

Beyond being beasts of burden, mule flesh was favored by [[halfling]] cooks.

document_data.Trivia:
